allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat: add lessons 001 and 002 for multi-agent system learning

Lesson 001: YouTube Video Tagging Agent
- Fetches YouTube transcripts using youtube-transcript-api
- Analyzes content with Pydantic AI and Claude Haiku
- Generates 3-5 relevant tags for read-it-later apps
- CLI interface with single and interactive modes

Lesson 002: Webpage Content Tagging Agent
- Fetches webpages using Docling (IBM Research)
- Converts HTML to clean Markdown
- Strips ads, navigation, and UI elements
- Reuses 80% of code from Lesson 001
- 15k character truncation for cost control

Project Structure:
- Shared .venv in root (saves ~7GB per lesson)
- Dependencies via pyproject.toml dependency groups
- Each lesson follows consistent architecture pattern
- Added STATUS.md for resuming work on different machines

Based on Cole Medin''s "Learn 90% of Building AI Agents in 30 Minutes"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i5kwX7jeWL8

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
docs: update CLAUDE.md with lesson-003 patterns and comprehensive docs

- Added terminology note (local vs personal ruleset)
- Updated project overview with multi-agent learning focus
- Added Quick Start section for first-time users and resuming work
- Documented lessons structure and dependency management
- Added API keys and environment setup guidance
- Updated development commands for lesson-based workflow
- Moved container/infrastructure to background section
- Added summary for new Claude sessions

Focus: Better onboarding for AI assistant and human developers

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
